div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

span.style: font-size: x-large; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 128);

td.span: Governor Abbott has announced that all schools will remain closed for remainder of 2019-2020 school year

td.strong: Lunch Pickup and Assignment Pickup/Drop off will be Monday, April 20, 2020 from 7:30-2pm

span.strong: Lunch Pickups on Mondays from 11am to 1pm

tr.td: *Please stay in your car when picking up assignments/food. The school staff will bring all necessary supplies to your car. All buildings will be locked and no one may enter the buildings.

a.title: Letter
a.span:
Letter from Superintendent Concerning Remainder of School Year
PLEASE READ

a.title: Letter
a.span: 2020-2021 Union Hill FFA and Jr. FFA Livestock Show

td.br: Seniors, please email your pictures to massingillm@uhisd.com or include them with your April 20th Schoolwork Dropoff

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

a.title: Letter
a.span: Important Letter to All Band Students 6-12

tr.td: The last round of senior scholarships will be included with schoolwork and be ready for pick up on Wednesday 3/25. Each senior will receive both official and unofficial transcripts in their packets. If more transcripts are needed a pick up will be arranged at a later date. The counselor will not be collecting any scholarship applications. Please mail them directly to the intended recipient. The local scholarship application is included in the packet. An interview will not be required for any local scholarships. Please pay attention to due dates and contact Mrs. Youngblood with any questions. Youngbloodc@uhisd.com

td.style: text-align: center; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;

span.style: font-size: 12.8px; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

br.span: Union Hill ISD has 100% Highly Qualified Staff

span.style: font-size: 12.8px; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

div.span: Additional information may be obtained by calling (903) 762-2140

p.span:
Union Hill ISD Mission Statement
The mission of Union Hill I.S.D. is to provide quality educational opportunities and resources to all students equally and to teach skills required to pursue a higher education or to enter into the diverse, ever-changing society. A comprehensive curriculum will be taught with strong emphasis on good citizenship, social skills, and problem-solving skills.
Strong emphasis will be placed on high expectations, mutual respect, and life-long learning for all students, PK through grade 12, to achieve their full potential.
Parents, teachers, administrators, school board, and community will work together to reach our goals and to ensure a safe environment conductive to learning.
